intro: Euphrasia woronowii, commonly known as the Siberian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Eastern Europe and Siberia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Euphrasia woronowii is valued in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
